puzzle.title: Four Books Walk Into a Bar...
puzzle.hint: Fill in the missing word (covered up by gray bar) for each title
Each missing word letter is represented by either dots or numbers
The missing words are: OCTOPUS, DRAGON, JACKAL, HERRING
Shift letters by the numbers (zero means no change; dot means don't use that letter)
The solution is BIRD BRAIN.

puzzle.title: One Way... or Not
puzzle.hint: How many items are in each square?
5 items per square is? The shapes of the items seem like something
The code is binary. Shapes are ones and zeroes

puzzle.title: Surgical Wordplay
puzzle.hint: Each line creates 2 words with only one letter difference
First answer is SNACK/SHACK
Use the letters that are different for final answer
Left side answers: SNACK, STEPS, PEACH, CLUMP, SHILL, GRAIL, BLEND, SCORE, SHOVE, TICKS, TWINS, BOATS, BLINK

puzzle.title: Experimental Equipment
puzzle.hint: If folded correctly, right side of bird should read "WING DISKS"
Open bird and look at circled words on wings: "SHIFT OTHERS TWO"
Shift remaining wing letters ("UFC LNG EQ DJW") by 2 to get answer

puzzle.title: What Am I Looking At?
puzzle.hint: Match each image on the top row with another image on the bottom row to make a compound word
Words are: FOOTBALL, BRAINSTORM, CATFISH, SHOEHORN, TREEHOUSE, HORSESHOE, CUPCAKE, KEYSTONE, BOOKWORM, TABLESPOON
Look at the lines created for a final extraction
Extract letters only where the lines cross ("X")

puzzle.title: Covert-y Words-y
puzzle.hint: You are looking for groups of 3 boxes
Within each group there is one card that is the thing, and the two others are rhyming descriptions of the thing
Draw lines from the thing out to the rhyming words
Things and rhymes are: NIGHTMARE (SCREAMY DREAMY), POSTAGE STAMP (LICKIE STICKIE), PREGNANCY TEST (MAYBE BABY), HIPPO (FLOATIE BLOATIE), DEFIBRILLATOR (HEARTY STARTY), FORK (STABBY GRABBY)
What do the lines look like?
Extraction is semaphore

puzzle.title: Maybe Everyone Traveled Away
puzzle.hint: Match pictures to previous answers using similar phrases

Matches:
- oil drum (snake oil) SNAKE EYES - present (gift horse) HORSE FEATHERS - bacon (pork product) WHEN PIGS FLY - banana (primate food) MONKEY BUSINESS - kangaroo (character's superpower) POCKET
The numbers of pictures is a clue
The title "IDIOMATIC NETWORK DIAGRAM EXPLOIT: XYLOPHONE" is telling you something
First letters of the title spells INDEX
Index into each answer by the number of pictures per box
